articles.summary: Elon ​Musk's SpaceX ⁠is weighing a mid-June ‌2026 ‌initial public ‌offering, aiming to raise as much ​as $50 billion ​at a ‌valuation ‍of ‍roughly $1.5 trillion, the Financial ‌Times reported, citing people familiar with ‍the matter.

articles.title: India’s industrial output growth hits over two-year high of 7.8% in December
articles.summary: December 2025 witnessed an impressive upswing in India's industrial production, rising by 7.8 percent annually—the fastest growth rate seen in over two years. The manufacturing, mining, and electricity sectors played pivotal roles in this advancement, notably with infrastructure and construction goods at the forefront. This momentum heralds a significant economic flourishing as the year wraps up.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices at record highs: Why India may increase duties on their imports
articles.summary: India's gold and silver imports hit record highs in 2025, despite soaring prices, raising concerns over the widening trade deficit and a weakening rupee. Policymakers face challenges curbing these inflows, as investment demand, particularly in ETFs, has surged, offsetting a slowdown in jewellery purchases.

articles.title: Iran unrest does not have a significant impact on India Inc’s global trade: Crisil
articles.summary: While India Inc's global trade and credit profiles remain largely unaffected by Iran's unrest, potential disruptions loom for sectors like oil refining, aviation, and crude-linked industries if tensions escalate. Direct trade with Iran is minimal, but rising crude prices could impact various sectors, with basmati rice and fruit/nut traders facing specific challenges.

articles.title: Elon Musk planning world's largest IPO: What investors need to know about the once-in-a-generation SpaceX listing
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s SpaceX may be heading for a record-breaking IPO, potentially raising $50 billion. From reusable rockets to Starlink’s recurring revenue, the listing could reshape global markets while testing investor appetite for future technologies.

articles.title: European shares pause after two-day rally; ASML bucks weakness
articles.summary: European shares took a breather on Wednesday after two consecutive days of gains ‌as ‌investors parsed through a string of earnings updates and executive commentary, ‌while ASML hit a record high.

articles.title: Japan's Nikkei escapes losses as tech share gains offset drag from strong yen
articles.summary: Japan's Nikkei ‍share average ended slightly ​higher on Wednesday, buoyed in the final half-hour ⁠of trade by stronger-than-expected orders at Dutch chip equipment maker ASML.

articles.title: Shadowfax bets big on e-commerce and quick commerce as scale, tech and automation drive profitability
articles.summary: Shadowfax is at the forefront of India's last-mile logistics evolution. The company is experiencing strong growth driven by e-commerce and quick commerce. Aggressive expansion into new areas and technology are key. Shadowfax is improving efficiency and profitability. The company is set to play a significant role in the country's logistics future.

articles.title: Value hunting back on the table as markets navigate global flux
articles.summary: Indian investors are seeking value amidst global market volatility, with expert Punita Kumar Sinha advising a selective approach. While commodities and real estate show promise, equities remain dominant, especially for those with limited overseas investment options. Sinha emphasizes stock-specific opportunities over broad sector calls, particularly in IT and capital expenditure cycles.

articles.title: Shriram Finance shares nearly double in a year. Will the stock sustain its strong momentum?
articles.summary: Shriram Finance shares have nearly doubled in a year, driven by strong AUM growth, improving margins and MUFG’s strategic investment. Analysts remain positive on fundamentals but warn of near-term consolidation as momentum indicators signal overbought levels.

articles.title: Swiggy Q3 Preview: Losses to widen as Instamart investments weigh; revenue may jump 47% YoY
articles.summary: Swiggy is expected to post strong revenue growth of about 47% YoY in Q3FY26, led by steady food delivery demand and a sharp rise in quick commerce. However, continued investments in Instamart, rising competition, and dark store expansion costs are likely to widen losses, with brokerages estimating a Q3 loss in the range of Rs 804–1,045 crore.

articles.title: CarTrade Tech shares slide 11% as investors look past Q3 revenue growth,  margin expansion
articles.summary: CarTrade Tech shares slid sharply after the company reported strong December-quarter profit growth and a significant expansion in margins, with investors focusing instead on a slowdown in revenue growth compared with the prior quarter.

articles.title: Budget, earnings revival crucial to lure FIIs back to India: Punita Kumar Sinha
articles.summary: As India braces for budget week, market watchers are seeking catalysts to lure back cautious foreign institutional investors. Persistent outflows and concerns over earnings trajectory and valuations have weighed on sentiment. However, strategist Punita Kumar Sinha believes pessimism is overdone, highlighting potential positive triggers like the EU trade deal and budget announcements.

articles.title: Vietnam raises $323.8 mln in government bond auction
articles.summary: Vietnam's State Treasury secured 8.44 trillion dong from its latest government bond auction, a dip from the previous week's 12 trillion dong offering. While 58% of bonds were sold, the auction saw no uptake for 5- and 30-year maturities. This brings the year's total government bond sales to 24.4 trillion dong, crucial for funding public investments and economic growth.

articles.title: One 97 Communications Q3 Preview: Paytm parent may post up to 22% YoY revenue growth. Check PAT, margin expectations
articles.summary: Paytm is expected to post another profitable Q3, driven by festive-led demand in payments and financial services. Brokerages forecast a return to year-on-year profitability, around 6% sequential growth, and continued margin expansion, with revenue seen rising up to 22% YoY to about Rs 2,187–2,225 crore.

articles.title: Oil India shares jump nearly 10%, extend gains for second session. What’s behind the surge?
articles.summary: Oil India shares saw a significant jump on Wednesday. This rise followed a sharp increase in global crude oil prices, reaching a four-month peak. Geopolitical tensions, including concerns over US-Iran and Russia-Ukraine conflicts, along with supply disruptions, fueled the market sentiment. Analysts suggest a positive technical outlook for the stock.

articles.title: ONGC shares jump 6% after JV signs shipbuilding deal with Samsung Heavy Industries
articles.summary: ONGC shares rose nearly 6% after its joint venture with Mitsui O.S.K. Lines signed shipbuilding contracts with Samsung Heavy Industries for two ethane carriers, strengthening energy logistics for OPaL and reinforcing bullish valuation and technical indicators.

articles.title: Crypto markets cautious as Bitcoin nears $89,000, Ethereum eyes $3,000
articles.summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum showed cautious optimism, nearing $89,000 and $3,000 respectively, as buyers re-entered key support zones ahead of the Federal Reserve's rate decision. While major altcoins saw significant gains, Bitcoin and Ethereum are expected to trade within consolidation ranges until a clear macro trigger emerges.

articles.title: Digital Real Estate: How Budget 2026 can revive affordable housing, Anuj Puri decodes
articles.summary: India’s housing market risks deepening inequality as affordable supply collapses despite booming luxury sales. With EMIs surging, demand unmet and developers abandoning low-margin projects, Budget 2026 must revive incentives, expand infrastructure, update affordability norms and strengthen subsidies to restore balance and make homeownership achievable for the middle class.

articles.title: Tata Consumer Products shares tumble 5% after Q3. What should investors do?
articles.summary: Tata Consumer Products shares dropped significantly on Wednesday. This occurred even as the company reported a 38% year-on-year profit jump and 15% revenue increase for the December quarter. Analysts from Morgan Stanley, Motilal Oswal, and JM Financial provided their views on the stock. Their recommendations range from Overweight to Buy and ADD, with varying price targets.

articles.title: Silver soars Rs 21,400, nears Rs 4 lakh mark; gold jumps Rs 4,800 to fresh record high. Is it too late to buy?
articles.summary: Gold and silver futures opened higher on Wednesday, January 28, 2026, hitting fresh lifetime highs on the MCX amid strong safe-haven demand and rising geopolitical tensions. Investors now await the US Federal Reserve’s policy decision, with any signal of a rate pause or easing likely to boost market sentiment and support further gains in precious metals.

articles.title: AI to replace repetitive jobs, create new opportunities: Science advisor
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a disruptive technology and will replace a lot of repetitive jobs, but will also create new opportunities and India has to be prepared for this realignment, the government's top science advisor said.

articles.title: Robotics startup AquaAirX raises Rs 12.5 crore from Zerodha's Rainmatter, Prime Venture Partners, others
articles.summary: Robotics startup AquaAirX, which builds drones, has raised Rs 12.5 crore in a round led by Rainmatter, the investment arm of Zerodha. The round also saw participation from Prime Venture Partners, Wyser and India Accelerator.

articles.title: Why a 70:30 India-global portfolio makes sense in a changing world, Subho Moulik decodes
articles.summary: As global markets outperform India, diversification is gaining urgency. Subho Moulik explains why a 70:30 India global portfolio improves risk adjusted returns, reduces concentration risk, and provides access to long term global growth themes such as AI, defence, and quantum computing.

articles.title: F&O Talk | Nifty cracks 5% in 11 days: Is this just the beginning of a deeper slide? Sudeep Shah weighs in
articles.summary: Indian equity markets closed the week on a subdued note, impacted by profit-booking and foreign investor outflows. Global trade concerns and domestic earnings disappointments weighed on sentiment. Analysts suggest caution ahead of the Budget, with Nifty facing resistance and broader markets showing weakness. PSU banks are outperforming private peers.

articles.title: Juspay turns unicorn; Infra.Market IPO gets Sebi nod
articles.summary: Juspay became India's first unicorn of 2026 after a fresh funding round. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Sensex and Nifty edge modestly higher on easing geopolitical jitters
articles.summary: Indian equities opened marginally higher on Friday, extending a modest recovery after a three-session decline. Gains in Asian markets and easing geopolitical tensions provided some support, but persistent foreign fund outflows and mixed corporate results maintained investor caution.

articles.title: Why New Delhi isn’t losing sleep over the rupee
articles.summary: The Indian rupee is falling as foreign investors withdraw funds and the RBI sells dollars. A trade deal with the US could reverse this trend. India's economy is strong and can absorb higher import costs. The US focus on tariffs may keep oil prices low, aiding India's growth. Washington will eventually reconsider its tariff policy, benefiting the rupee.

articles.title: View: India is cornered by China’s lock on tech
articles.summary: India-China trade: India's industrial growth faces a new challenge as China restricts technology transfers. This impacts key sectors like electric vehicles and energy storage, affecting major Indian conglomerates. Despite recent diplomatic overtures, Beijing's stance highlights a significant technology gap. India's 'Make in India' initiative struggles against this dominance.

articles.title: Sensex falls over 300 pts, Nifty below 25,500 amid trade worries and foreign selling
articles.summary: Indian stock markets continued their downward trend on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty experiencing a second consecutive session of declines. Investors are closely monitoring global trade uncertainties and ongoing foreign fund outflows, while the quarterly earnings season also captures market attention. The Sensex dropped over 300 points, and the Nifty 50 fell more than 90 points.

articles.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: Indian economy shows steady momentum in December, says new monthly economy index by Moneycontrol
articles.summary: Moneycontrol’s Eco Pulse is a composite high-frequency index which aims to measure India’s economic momentum on a monthly basis and provide early signals of changes in the direction of GDP growth

articles.title: AAI to invest ₹15,000 crore by 2028 to modernise ATC, navigational systems
articles.summary: Speaking to reporters on the sidelines of Wings India 2026, AAI chairman Vipin Kumar said India’s largest airport operator is expected to post revenues of ₹22,000 crore in the current financial year, the same as last year.

articles.title: Eicher Pro X EV becomes first electric truck to finish Kashmir to Kanyakumari in 6-day run
articles.summary: Eicher Pro X EV completed the Kashmir to Kanyakumari route in a fully loaded condition, covering over 4,000 km in six days and setting four records recognised by the India Book of Records.

articles.title: HAL to set up final assembly line in India for Russia’s SJ100 passenger jet
articles.summary: HAL to set up SJ100 aircraft assembly line in Nashik with United Aircraft Corporation, lease 20 SJ100s, and expand civil aviation share to 25 percent. Shares rose 6.54 percent to ₹4,633.

articles.title: Shambhavi Pathak, Sumit Kapoor and two others who died in plane crash along with Ajit Pawar
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar and four others died in a Learjet 45 crash at Baramati airport. Victims include Sumit Kapoor, Shambhavi Pathak, Pinki Mali, and Vidhit Jadhav.

With elections approaching, the party’s next moves and leadership plans remain unclear, leaving Maharashtra politics in a state of flux.

articles.title: Bikaji Foods confident of margin rebound, steady growth ahead: CFO Rishabh Jain
articles.summary: Rishabh Jain, CFO of Bikaji Foods International, said the company has acquired an investor stake in the Hazelnut Factory, a bakery and premium sweets business, which is performing well. He stated that when the stake was acquired last year, the topline was close to ₹50 crore, with the business now seeing a run rate of around ₹100 crore and on track to reach nearly ₹250 crore over the next two years.

articles.title: Asian Paints says volume growth to hold at 8-10%, steps up brand and innovation spends
articles.summary: Asian Paints MD & CEO Amit Syngle said that competition in the paints industry will continue to stay intense, with pressure coming mainly from pricing and new market approaches.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar's plane crashed after losing control, caught fire and exploded: Eyewitnesses
articles.summary: The illfated aircraft carrying Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar appeared "a bit unstable in the air" and exploded the moment it crashed on the ground near Baramati in Pune district on Wednesday morning, according to a woman eyewitness.

articles.title: Closing Bell | Markets end higher for a second straight session as Nifty tops 25,300
articles.summary: Closing Bell | Markets ended higher for a second straight session, with Nifty closing above 25,300, midcaps outperforming, and sharp stock-specific moves driven by earnings, oil price gains and order wins.

articles.title: Maharashtra Dy CM Ajit Pawar's plane crash captured in CCTV | Video
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar and four others died in a plane crash near Baramati, Pune. Chilling CCTV footage shows the deadly descent. Emergency teams and DGCA are investigating as family members arrive.

articles.title: US Stock Market LIVE Updates: S&P 500 on the verge of scaling 7,000 ahead of Fed decision, tech results

Not just for the US Federal Reserve announcing its interest rate decision, but also for a slew of tech names that will be reporting their quarterly results after the bell. Ahead of this important trading session, the same tech shares are leading the Nasdaq futures higher by nearly 200 points. As a results, the S P 500 futures are also trading 20 points higher, and if those gains sustain, the index may well open above the mark of

articles.title: Maharashtra's top post eluded Ajit Pawar after six stints as Deputy CM
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s deputy chief minister six times, died in a Baramati air crash, leaving his dream of becoming chief minister unfulfilled and NCP’s future uncertain.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: What we know about Learjet 45 aircraft and operator VSR Ventures
articles.summary: Five people, including Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, died when a VSR Ventures Bombardier Learjet 45 crashed during landing at Baramati on a Mumbai–Baramati flight, with AAIB leading the probe.

articles.title: Crude oil prices may average $59-60/barrel in 2026 amid geopolitical risks: S&P Global Energy
articles.summary: S P Global Energy President Dave Ernsberger said oil and gas markets are adjusting to geopolitical and trade uncertainties without major disruption. Ernsberger also said India has more options to diversify its energy suppliers, which supports the country’s energy security.

articles.title: NASA plane touches down without landing gear, flames erupt | Watch
articles.summary: NASA WB-57 research plane landed without gear at Ellington Airport, Texas, after a mechanical issue. Crew is safe. The aircraft slid on its belly with flames but no injuries were reported.

articles.title: Shadowfax targets ₹4,000-4,500 crore revenue in FY26, sees gradual margin improvement
articles.summary: Shadowfax CEO Abhishek Bansal said quick commerce could grow to up to 40% of business over the next few years, while value-added services will remain a key revenue driver. Shadowfax shares listed at a discount to the issue price on both the BSE and NSE.

articles.title: Budget 2026 unlikely to move markets in a big way: Samir Arora
articles.summary: Helios Capital’s Samir Arora said that lower taxes could improve sentiment and returns, while currency weakness continues to hurt foreign investors.

articles.title: Auto sector eyes EV incentives, infra spending in Budget; Ashok Leyland top pick: BNP Paribas
articles.summary: Kumar Rakesh, India Analyst-Auto and IT at BNP Paribas, said the recent volatility in auto stocks was an overreaction, drawing parallels with earlier market jitters around Tesla’s potential entry into India and the UK–India trade deal discussions.

articles.title: ASML posts record orders, lifts 2026 outlook as AI demand surges
articles.summary: The Dutch firm's bookings came in at €13.2 billion in the December quarter of 2025, ahead of analyst estimates of €6.32 billion, as per Visible Alpha, cited by Reuters, CNBC reported. This was a record quarter for the company's orders, as per the firm's finance chief Roger Dassen.

articles.title: Earnings stabilising but valuations still a hurdle for markets: Kotak's Sanjeev Prasad
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities’ Sanjeev Prasad said foreign investor interest may stay weak due to expensive Indian stocks and stronger opportunities in other Asian markets.

articles.title: Foreign investors cautious on India amid global rotation and gold rally: Manulife’s Marc Franklin
articles.summary: Marc Franklin, Deputy Head-Multi Asset Solutions-Asia at Manulife Investments, said investor interest in Indian equities could return quickly if global capital flows reverse or momentum in competing asset classes cools, supported by strong underlying fundamentals.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices in India hit all-time highs on strong global cues
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India hit all-time highs on MCX, driven by global gains, US policy uncertainty, a weaker dollar, and strong safe-haven and industrial demand, say analysts.

articles.title: Apple shares may be rangebound post-earnings. How to use options to wring out profits anyway
articles.summary: Apple has dropped 15% in a month. Nishant Pant suggests an iron condor options strategy ahead of AAPL earnings, targeting the $245 to $265 range for optimal risk reward.

articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash in Baramati. The plane was a Learjet 45 aircraft that took off from Mumbai at around 8:10 am on January 28. The jet disappeared from radar shortly before 8:45 am.

This agreement is expected to boost India's electronics exports to $50 billion by 2031. Indian companies will also benefit from cheaper access to advanced European machinery for producing complex electronics and semiconductors.

Defendants in the suit are Alphabet, ByteDance and Meta, the tech titans behind YouTube, TikTok and Instagram. Meta cofounder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg is slated to be called as a witness during the trial.

The newly launched IoT-enabled converter device allows automation of up to three electrical appliances using a single unit, which can be controlled through a mobile application.
